properties.name: Bell Con 2007, Oct. 13, Bellingham, WA
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeBellingham, WABell Con 2007 is on October 13 2007 at the Majestic in Bellingham, Washington. 40 minutes south of Vancouver, BC and 90 minutes north of Seattle. The Address: 1027 N. Forest Street, Bellingham, WA 98225 For more info contact Jason at 360-778-1033 TICKETS are .00 a person and are availible the day of the event. It is between 10-4 Special Guests include: Vintage Comics Carnell Thought Box Comics Ben Hanson Lucky Carrot Consortium Rorschach Entertainment The Comics Place Cosmic Comics Comics Dungeon Amano Jyaku Brandon Jerwa Jack Stepp Docking Bay 93 J&J Collectables Mike Grell Michael Gange Nadir Balan Rantz Darren Davis Kids from Comic Camp Arcana Studios Bluewater Tom Peyer Nic Carcieri Atomic Pop Art Brain O. Randolph Village Books Merch-Bot Dark Horse Comics Whiz Kids Bellingham Public Library Cascadia Weekly Ken Smith / Mary Wood More to be annouced soon!

properties.name: Bristol International Comic Expo Film Night 2008
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeBristol, United KingdomOrang Utan Comics are proud to present the official Bristol International Comic Expo Film Night 2008. Held on May 9th at 6pm at the Ramada Plaza Hotel in Bristol, this year\'s Film Night will be bigger and better than ever. So far we are pleased to announce the - first ever \'Ray Harryhausen Presents\' production; the legendary visual effects creator, animator and producer presents The Pit And The Pendulum, a stock motion animated short based on the Edgar Alan Poe classic. There will be a collection during the evening for charity in aid of the Orangutan Foundation UK. There will be a bar at the rear of the auditorium. Entry is FREE, and the first 100 people through the door on the night will also receive a Goody Bag from hosts Orang Utan Comics, sponsored by Forbidden Planet London!

properties.name: Cinema Wasteland Cinemashow, Oct. 5-7
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee 12905 York Delta Dr, Cleveland, OHCleveland, Ohio! MOVIE, MOVIES and more MOVIES! We cram in as many classic Drive-In movies, independent films and shorts as we can pack into a weekend. You’ll find movies and shorts on real 16mm film in our 200 seat “Film Room” and all kinds of indy films, shorts, and guest related features in our smaller, 100 seat “Video and DVD projection Room” all weekend long.

properties.name: RavenCon 2008
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee Chantilly, VAScience Fiction & Fantasy return to Richmond with RavenCon 2008, a weekend celebrating the genres of Science Fiction, Fantasy and Horror. (And as we\'re playing the Edgar Allan Poe angle, we\'re Mystery friendly, too!) Join our guests for panel discussions and workshops that can only happen at RavenCon! The Pit and the Pendulum will be screening at RavenCon 2008 over the weekend- if you\'re in town, have a watch and see what all is happening!

properties.name: SiliCon 2007, Oct. 5-7, San Jose, CA
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeSan Jose, CANEW UPDATES! We have some new events added; Kei/Lolita Fashion Show, Machinima Festival, Midnight Movie Massacre Hosted by Horror Yearbook.com. New guests include; SFX Director Joe Catsro ("Terror Toons"), Writer Dan Wickline ("30 Days of Nights"), Screenwriter Todd Farmer ("Jason X" & "Clock Tower"), Manga Artist Melissa Hudson (Demented Dragon") and many more have joined SiliCon 2007! Check out our Guest page for more info. Stay tuned for more news about events, guests, and other special programming coming soon!

properties.name: Texas Frightmare Weekend
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee1590 Lyndon B Johnson Fwy, Dallas, TXYes, it\'s true. Director George Romero will be hosting the Texas Frightmare Weekend in Dallas, Texas June 22-24, 2007, and THE PIT AND THE PENDULUM will be screening at the event. Should be alot of fun, with ton\'s of special guests attending the event, including Adrienne Barbeau (Creepshow), Jeffrey Combs (Re- Animator) and a host of other folks horror film fans will not want to miss. http://www.texasfrightmareweekend.com
